intro: Gurania spinulosa, commonly known as the spiny gurania, is a perennial flowering plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible seeds. The plant features upright, branched stems covered in small, spiny protrusions, giving it a rugged appearance. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a reddish or purple tint, especially along the veins. It produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer.
